answerText: "The British Prison-Ship"[10] The speaker of this other poem by that author notes, "I still my old opinion keep, / the posture, that we give the dead, points out the soul's eternal sleep."
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 1 | 11 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The third of the four cantos of this poem details the visit of a Hessian doctor who poorly treats the dying for ten minutes each day, while another part describes the daily ritual of burying dead bodies on the beach. For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem that was based on the author's actual experiences during his two months on the Hunter and the Scorpion.
